intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. ellipticifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped to elliptic leaves that are often slightly hairy, and it typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils. It is part of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to alpine gardens and ecological restoration projects.
